org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj.rendering.gles20

Class ShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj.rendering.gles20.ShaderProgram
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseShaderProgram

    public abstract class ShaderProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Thorsten Bux on 21.01.2016.

    The shader program links together the vertex shader and the fragment shader and compiles them. It also is responsible for binding the attributes. Attributes can be used to pass in values to the shader during runtime.

    It is important to call setupShaderUsage() as first method inside your implementation of the render(float[]) render()} method.

    This abstract class provides the basic implementation for binding shaders see createProgram(int, int) you can just call this method and do not need to worry about binding shaders.

    This class also provides stubs of methodes you might want to override when you create your own Shader Program. You can see an example Shader Program in BaseShaderProgram

    Finally it renders the given geometry.

      • render

        public void render(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexBuffer,
                   java.nio.FloatBuffer colorBuffer,
                   java.nio.ByteBuffer indexBuffer)
        Full loaded render function. You should at least override this one. You need to set the projection and/or modelview matrix befor calling a render method.
        Parameters:
        vertexBuffer - position vertex information
        colorBuffer - color information
        indexBuffer - index

      • render

        public void render(java.nio.FloatBuffer vertexBuffer,
                   java.nio.ByteBuffer indexBuffer)

      • render

        public void render(float[] position)
        Only render a simple position. In this case the implementation if forwarded to the render(FloatBuffer, FloatBuffer, ByteBuffer) but you can override this one directly as shown in BaseShaderProgram
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be rendered

      • setupShaderUsage

        protected void setupShaderUsage()
        Sets some basic settings for shader usage. Needs to be called as first method from your implementation inside the renderer() method.
